alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Harrison; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Doddridge, southeastern Tyler and western Harrison Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Union, or 16 miles southeast of Middlebourne, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salem, West Union, West Milford, New Milton, Wallace, Smithburg, Blandville, Center Point, Sedalia, Avon, Canton and Wolf Summit. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 51 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
